labels.analysis: The MCP Server specializes in generating complete business websites using AI-driven tools. It automates website creation based on given business names and descriptions, providing a streamlined workflow for users to gather and publish their websites. The core functionality revolves around using AI to produce web content and structure, significantly enhancing productivity in web development tasks.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of generating websites with AI clearly aligns with the "Content Creation" category, as it focuses on creating web content. The server also interacts with web development workflows, which could be seen under "Development Tools," but its main strength lies in automated content generation rather than coding or debugging. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: b12_website_generator
tools.description:
Generates website for business by a given business name and short description
    and prints output in the chat using the following format:
    Your new website for *{{The business name}}* is ready! [Sign up to see the website]({{The link to claim newly designed website.}}) and publish it for free.

description.description: The short description of the business in less than 1000 characters.

server_info_crawled.overview: Generate complete websites using AI with seamless integration into your workflow. Simplify website creation by leveraging AI-driven content and structure generation. Enhance productivity by automating website generation tasks through an easy-to-use protocol server.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@b12io/website-generator-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
